app Module¶

Api methods¶

POST /create_activate¶

Create site and activate given plan

Json Parameters:
 
  • site (string) – site name to create
  • plan (string) – plan to activate
POST /update_plan¶

Update plan

Delete plan and create new with given params

Json Parameters:
 
  • name (string) – plan to be changed
  • checks (list) – checks in the plan
  • active (bool) – if plan is active
  • include_plans (list) – other existing plans. Checks from this plans will be included to this plan

Post data:

{
        "name": "Test",
        "include_plans": [
                "Basic"
                ],
        "checks":["bla_plan"],

        "active": true
}

Example request:

POST /update_plan
Accept: application/json, text/javascript
Content-Type:    application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json
{
    "status": "OK",
    "name": "Test"
}
GET /get_plans¶

Get all active plans

Return all plans checks

Example request:

GET /get_plans
Accept: application/json, text/javascript
Content-Type:    application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type:    application/json

{
  "status": "OK",
  "plans":{
  "test": [
    "bla_plan"
  ],
  "professional": [
    "uname",
    "netstat"
  ],
  "basic": [
    "cpu"
  ]
  }
}
POST /add_plan¶

Add new plan with checks

If plan already exists returns error

Json Parameters:
 
  • name (string) – plan to be changed
  • checks (list) – checks in the plan
  • active (bool) – if plan is active
  • include_plans (list) – other existing plans. Checks from this plans will be included to this plan

Post data:

{
        "name": "Test",
        "include_plans": [
                "Basic"
                ],
        "checks":["bla_plan"],

        "active": true
}

Example request:

POST /add_plan
Accept: application/json, text/javascript
Content-Type:    application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json
{
    "status": "OK",
    "name": "Test"
}
GET /delete_check/(plan)/(check)¶

Deletes check from given plan

Add check to exclude_checks list

Parameters:
  • plan (string) – plan to be changed
  • check (string) – check to be removed from the plan

Example request:

GET /delete_check/professional/new
Accept: application/json, text/javascript
Content-Type:    application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json
{
  "status": "OK",
  "check": "new",
  "plan": "professional"
}
GET /add_check/(plan)/(check)¶

Add check to given plan

Parameters:
  • plan (string) – plan to be changed
  • check (string) – check to be added to the plan

Example request:

GET /add_check/professional/new
Accept: application/json, text/javascript
Content-Type:    application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json
{
  "status": "OK",
  "check": "new",
  "plan": "professional"
}
GET /delete_plan/(name)¶

Delete plan

Parameters:
  • name (string) – plan name

Example request:

GET /delete_plan/professional

Content-Type:    application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type    application/json

}

GET /url¶

404 handler

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type    application/json

{'status': 'error', 'message': 'Not found: url'}
code 404:unknown url

Common methods¶

app.make_json_app(import_name, **kwargs)¶

Creates a JSON-oriented Flask app.

All error responses that you don’t specifically manage yourself will have application/json content type, and will contain JSON like this (just an example):

{ “message”: “405: Method Not Allowed” }
